alert.note: Alert for Lavaca (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 07 at 10:40PM CST until January 08 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT FOR NORTHWESTERN LAVACA COUNTY... At 1040 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Shiner, Moulton, Komensky, Witting, Breslau, Moravia and Henkhaus. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
